examples/ex3_createCharactrztn.c File Reference

Detailed Description

Example of creating a new characterization.

Description:

This annotated example presents a simple example of creating a new characterization.

Please see ex1_intro.c and ex2_bigDataAccess.c first for examples of data access and using built-in FCLib characterizations.

NOTE: If you are looking at this file through the Doxygen interface, all objects and functions are linked to their documentation--so follow the links for more details!

NOTE: Don't forget to try running the program while looking at this file.

Source
/usr/local/Repositories/fcdmf/fclib/examples/ex3_createCharactrztn.c,v
Revision
1.7
Date

Modifications:

  • 10/12/05 WSD, created. Split out of example 2 because gcc 4.0 didn't like function declarations within functions.

00252   // Get the hex mesh, the temperature sequence variable, and the sequence

00254   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00255     exit(rc);
00256   rc = fc_initLibrary();
00257   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00258     exit(rc);
00259   strcpy(dataset_name, "../data/gen_multivar_seq.ex2");

00261   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)

00265   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00266     exit(rc);
00267   if (numMeshes != 1){

00270   }
00271   mesh = meshes[0];
00272   free(meshes);
00273   strcpy(subset_name, "every 5th element");

00276   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00277     exit(rc);
00278   if (numReturnSubsets != 1)
00279     exit(FC_INPUT_ERROR);
00280   subset = returnSubsets[0];
00281   free(returnSubsets);
00282   strcpy(seqVariable_name, "temperature per vertex");
00283   rc = fc_getSeqVariableByName(mesh, seqVariable_name, &numReturnSeqVars,
00284                       &numStepPerReturnSeqVar,&returnSeqVars);
00285   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS || numReturnSeqVars != 1)
00286     exit(rc);
00287   numStep = numStepPerReturnSeqVar[0];

00290   free(returnSeqVars);

00293     exit(rc);
00294   fc_getSequenceName(sequence, &temp_name);
00295   strcpy(sequence_name, temp_name);
00296   free(temp_name);
00297   
00298   // Find the hot spots on the hex mesh and track them. (This is a little 
00299   // different from what we did in ex1_intro.c in that we'll track at
00300   // each step instead of all at once.)
00301   printf("Finding & Tracking hot spots:\n");
00302   rc = fc_createFeatureGroup(&featureGroup);
00303   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00304     exit(rc);
00305   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) {
00306     sprintf(char_buf, "Step%d_ThresholdSubset", i);
00307     rc = fc_createThresholdSubset(seqVariable[i], ">", 100., 
00308                       char_buf, &thresholdSubset);
00309     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00310       exit(rc);
00311     rc = fc_segment(thresholdSubset, 0, &numROI, &ROIs);
00312     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00313       exit(rc);
00314     rc = fc_trackStep(i, numROI, ROIs, featureGroup);
00315     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00316       exit(rc);
00317     fc_deleteSubset(thresholdSubset);
00318     free(ROIs);
00319   }
00320   fc_printFeatureGroup(featureGroup);
00321 
00322   // Now let's compare the normal average characterization with our
00323   // new funky average. Note that the funky average is always a little
00324   // greater than the normal average. This is what would be expected
00325   // as the hottest part of the feature (for this particular dataset)
00326   // lies in the center of the feature and we are weighing center
00327   // values more strongly in the funky average.
00328   printf("Comparing FCLib's average with the new funky average:\n");
00329   rc = fc_featureGroup_getNumFeature(featureGroup, &numFeature);
00330   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00331     exit(rc);
00332   for (i = 0; i < numFeature; i++) {
00333     rc = fc_getFeatureROIs(featureGroup, i, &numROI, &stepIDs, &ROIs);
00334     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00335       exit(rc);
00336     printf("Feature #%d:\n", i);
00337     printf("    numROI = %d\n", numROI);
00338     for (j = 0; j < numROI; j++) {
00339       rc = fc_getVariableSubsetMeanSdev(seqVariable[stepIDs[j]], ROIs[j], 
00340                          &average, NULL);
00341       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00342      exit(rc);
00343       rc = myCharacterizationFunkyAve(seqVariable[stepIDs[j]], ROIs[j], 
00344                           &funky_average);
00345       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00346      exit(rc);
00347       printf("    %d (Step #%d): FCLib's average  = %6g\n", j, stepIDs[j],
00348           average);
00349       printf("                 My funky average = %6g\n", funky_average); 
00350     }
00351     free(stepIDs);
00352     free(ROIs);
00353   }
00354   printf("\n");
00355   
00356   // Let's save the funky averages to print out differently later.
00357   // We'll make room to store an average for each feature for each
00358   // time step, but since most features do not exist over all
00359   // time steps, we are going to have some holes. Because we happen
00360   // to know that our averages will all be positive, if we 
00361   // initialize the storage space with -1's we'll be able to
00362   // see the holes more easily later.
00363   funky_averages = malloc(numFeature*sizeof(double*));
00364   for (i = 0; i < numFeature; i++) {
00365     funky_averages[i] = malloc(numStep*sizeof(double));
00366     for (j = 0; j < numStep; j++) 
00367       funky_averages[i][j] = -1;
00368   }
00369   for (i = 0; i < numFeature; i++) {
00370     fc_getFeatureROIs(featureGroup, i, &numROI, &stepIDs, &ROIs);
00371     for (j = 0; j < numROI; j++) {
00372       myCharacterizationFunkyAve(seqVariable[stepIDs[j]], ROIs[j], 
00373                      &funky_averages[i][stepIDs[j]]);
00374     }
00375     free(stepIDs);
00376     free(ROIs);
00377   }
00378   
00379   // As our final example in this annotated example, we'll print out the 
00380   // funky averages of the features in a plotable format.
00381   fc_getSequenceDataType(sequence, &dataType);
00382   fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(sequence, &seqCoords);
00383   printf("Funky Average for each feature: (-1 = no value for this step)\n");
00384   printf("----");
00385   for (i = 0; i < numFeature; i++) 
00386     printf("---------------");
00387   printf("\n");
00388   printf("%4s", "Time");
00389   for (i = 0; i < numFeature; i++) {
00390     sprintf(char_buf, "Feature%d", i);
00391     printf("%15s", char_buf);
00392   }
00393   printf("\n");
00394   printf("----");
00395   for (i = 0; i < numFeature; i++) 
00396     printf("---------------");
00397   printf("\n");
00398   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) {
00399     if (dataType == FC_DT_CHAR)
00400       printf("%4c", ((char*)seqCoords)[i]);
00401     else if (dataType == FC_DT_INT)
00402       printf("%4d", ((int*)seqCoords)[i]);
00403     else if (dataType == FC_DT_FLOAT)
00404       printf("%4.2f", ((float*)seqCoords)[i]);
00405     else if (dataType == FC_DT_DOUBLE)
00406       printf("%4.2f", ((double*)seqCoords)[i]);
00407     for (j = 0; j < numFeature; j++) {
00408       printf("%15.6g", funky_averages[j][i]);
00409     }
00410     printf("\n");
00411   }
00412   printf("\n");
00413   
00414   // Cleanup the dynamically allocated memory.
00415   for (i = 0; i < numFeature; i++)
00416     free(funky_averages[i]);
00417   free(funky_averages);
00418 
00419   // --- All done
00420 
00421   // Memory cleanup - Arrays of small data and data objects not managed
00422   // by the library.
00423   free(seqVariable);
00424   fc_freeFeatureGroup(featureGroup);
00425 
00426   // When you are all done it is a good idea to finalize the library.
00427   // This will automatically delete all datasets (and deleting a
00428   // dataset automatically deletes all of its sequences & meshes & etc.)
00429   fc_finalLibrary();
00430 
00431   // Bye!
00432   printf("... finished running ex3_createCharactrztn\n");
00433   exit(0);
00434 }

00087   FC_Mesh mesh;                    // will hold the subset's parent mesh

00094   // nonzero entries indicate member
00095   int numNeighbor, *neighborIDs;   // neighbors
00096   double value, sum;               // helpers to do calc
00097   int totalNum, tempNum;           // "
00098   
00099   // Set a default return value in case anything goes wrong
00100   if (funky_average)
00101     *funky_average = -1;
00102   
00103   // Check that the input arguments seem sane. fc_isXValid() routines
00104   // exist for all data types and return true if the handle refers
00105       // to something that really exists in the library.
00106   if (!fc_isVariableValid(var) || !fc_isSubsetValid(subset) ||
00107       !funky_average) {
00108     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00109   }
00110   
00111   // Get info from var & subset
00112   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(var, &numDataPoint, &numComponent, &assoc_var,
00113                  NULL,  &dataType);
00114   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00115     return rc;
00116   rc = fc_getSubsetInfo(subset, &numMember, &maxNumMember, &assoc_subset);
00117   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00118     return rc;
00119   
00120   // Do a little more checking - we refuse the right to serve variables
00121   // and subsets that do not meet our expectations!
00122   if (numComponent != 1 || numDataPoint < 1)  {
00123     fc_printfErrorMessage("Variable can only have 1 component not %d", 
00124                  numComponent);
00125     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00126   }
00127   if (!fc_isDataTypeValid(dataType) || dataType == FC_DT_UNKNOWN) {
00128     fc_printfErrorMessage("Can not operate on data type %s", 
00129                  fc_getDataTypeText(dataType));
00130     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00131   }
00132   if (assoc_var != assoc_subset || numDataPoint != maxNumMember) {
00133     fc_printfErrorMessage("Mismatch of entities");
00134     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00135   }
00136   if (numMember < 1) {
00137     fc_printfErrorMessage("Subset cannot be empty");
00138     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00139   }
00140   
00141   // Get variable big data & the subset members (we get the subset member
00142   // as a mask this time because we will want to quickly lookup whether
00143   // an entity is in the subset).
00144   rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(var, &datap);
00145   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00146     return rc;
00147   rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsMask(subset, &maxNumMember, &membersMask);
00148   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00149     return rc;
00150   // We are also going to need the parent mesh.
00151   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset, &mesh);
00152   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00153     return rc;
00154   
00155   // Basic algorithm for the calculation:
00156   // 1) step through each member of subset
00157   //    a) figure out how many neighbors of the member are also in the 
00158   //       subset
00159   //    b) decode the void* data array to get the value on the member
00160   //    c) increment the weighted sum and the total number of values count
00161   // 2) Calculate average.
00162   
00163   // Do the calculation. 
00164   
00165   // Initialize our number of values and the sum of the values to zero.
00166   totalNum = 0;
00167   sum = 0.;
00168   
00169   // The members are only the entities who's IDs in the mask are equal 
00170   // to 1.
00171   for (i = 0; i < maxNumMember; i++) {
00172     if (membersMask[i] > 0) {
00173       
00174       // This routine comes from the topo module and it returns the IDs of
00175       // the neighbors of an entity. We then count how many of these
00176       // neighbors are in the subset. Don't forget to free the neighborIDs!
00177       tempNum = 0;
00178       rc = fc_getMeshEntityNeighbors(mesh, i, assoc_subset, 0, 
00179                          &numNeighbor, &neighborIDs);
00180       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00181      return rc;
00182       for (j = 0; j < numNeighbor; j++) {
00183      if (membersMask[neighborIDs[j]] > 0)
00184        tempNum++;
00185       }
00186       free(neighborIDs);
00187       
00188       // Get the value of this member
00189       switch(dataType) {
00190       case FC_DT_INT:     value = ((int*)datap)[i];     break;
00191       case FC_DT_FLOAT:   value = ((float*)datap)[i];   break;
00192       case FC_DT_DOUBLE:  value = ((double*)datap)[i];  break;
00193       default: ; // should never reach here 
00194       }
00195       
00196       // Increment the weighted sum and the total number of values
00197       sum += tempNum * value;
00198       totalNum += tempNum;
00199     }
00200   }
00201   
00202   // cleanup (free allocated memory)
00203   free(membersMask);
00204   
00205   // Calculate the average and stuff into return variable.
00206   *funky_average = sum / totalNum;
00207   
00208   return FC_SUCCESS;
00209 }; // End of myCharacterizationFunkyAve()
